signalGreen

Class Junction

  • java.lang.Object
    • signalGreen.GisAgent
      • signalGreen.Junction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GiveWaySign, TrafficLight

    public class Junction
extends GisAgent
    Generic class for junctions of the Traffic Simulator.
    A Junction object is a node on a Graph. It can have a lane to any number of other Junction objects. Each lane can have the direction specified and these lanes represent Edges on the Graph. TrafficLights is a subclass of Junction, and has the special behavior of scheduling traffic light management.
    Author:
    Waqar

    • Method Detail

      • getJunctions

        public java.util.List<Junction> getJunctions()
        Returns:
        List of junctions that this junction has a lane between.

      • addJunction

        public void addJunction(Junction j)
        Tells the Junction about its adjacent Junctions. The given Junction is added to the List of Junctions that it now has a lane between.
        Parameters:
        j - is the other Junction the lane will be between.

      • removeLane

        public void removeLane(Junction junc,
              boolean out)
        Remove a lane between another Junction. This given Junction is removed from the List of Junctions that it has a lane between. It represents an Edge being removed on the Graph and is therefore updated on the Network Object.
        Parameters:
        junc - is the other Junction the lane is between.
        out - is a boolean flag for the lane direction being outward.

      • removeAllLanes

        public void removeAllLanes()
        Remove all lanes joining toward this Junction, the Graph will therefore have no Edges to this Node.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Two junctions with same coordinates are equivalent.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if junctions have the same coordinates

      • getVehiclesQueue

        public signalGreen.PriorityBlockingDeque<Vehicle> getVehiclesQueue(Junction j)
        Returns a list of vehicles that are running on a road segment from j to this junction. Assumes j is in the this.junctions list.
        Parameters:
        j - the junction
        Returns:
        queue of vehicles

      • getVehiclesMap

        public java.util.Map<Junction,signalGreen.PriorityBlockingDeque<Vehicle>> getVehiclesMap()
        Used by the context builder class only.
        Returns:
        all queues for initialisation purposes

      • enqueueVehicle

        public void enqueueVehicle(Junction j,
                  Vehicle v)
        Every vehicle entering a new road segment should call this method. Every junction holds a queue of vehicles running on a particular road segment going towards this junction from junction j.
        Parameters:
        j - junction at the other side of the current road segment
        v - vehicle entering a road segment

      • reorderVehicle

        public void reorderVehicle(Junction j,
                  Vehicle v)
        Once a vehicle has overtaken another vehicle it must tell the next junction its new position. This is done by re-adding the vehicle in the priority queue with its updated weight, the distance to the next junction.
        Parameters:
        j - previous junction
        v - vehicle

      • dequeueVehicle

        public boolean dequeueVehicle(Junction j,
                     Vehicle v)
        Every vehicle leaving a road segment should call this method. Vehicles are removed from queue.
        Parameters:
        j - junction at the other side of the current road segment
        v - vehicle leaving a road segment
        Returns:
        true if success
        See Also:
        enqueueVehicle(Junction j, Vehicle v)

      • peekVehicle

        public Vehicle peekVehicle(Junction j)
        Returns the closest vehicle to the current junction from junction j. It does not take into account lanes.
        Parameters:
        j - the junction
        Returns:
        v closest vehicle from j, if any

      • printVehiclesQueue

        public void printVehiclesQueue(Junction j)
        Debug the vehicles queue for a particular junction.
        Parameters:
        j - the junction

      • getNextVehicles

        public Vehicle[] getNextVehicles(Junction j,
                        Vehicle vehicle,
                        boolean checkAhead)
        Returns an array with size of 2 of vehicles that are ahead/behind of a given vehicle as follows:
        v[0] => Vehicle on Lane.OUTER
        v[1] => Vehicle on Lane.INNER
        Parameters:
        j - junction
        vehicle -
        checkAhead - check for vehicle ahead if true
        Returns:
        array of vehicles

      • getNumVehicles

        public int getNumVehicles(Junction j)
        How many vehicles there are on this road segment.
        Parameters:
        j - the origin junction
        Returns:
        number of vehicles
